descriptionText: Ensures that AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) endpoints have SSL configured for security. Source and target endpoints should have SSL enabled unless exempt.
detailedDescriptionText:
AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) endpoints should have SSL enabled to secure data in transit.

Without SSL, data transferred between DMS and its source/target endpoints is transmitted in plaintext, potentially exposing sensitive information to eavesdropping or man-in-the-middle attacks. This is particularly risky when migrations occur across public networks.

Enable SSL by setting the 'ssl_mode' parameter to 'verify-ca' or 'verify-full' in your aws_dms_endpoint resource. Provide appropriate certificate information using the 'certificate_arn' parameter to fully authenticate the connection, ensuring data confidentiality and integrity during the migration process.
